content.description: Easy climb with one balance move when you're clipping.  A couple great rests as you go and a nice stance for clipping/cleaning the anchors.

A really enjoyable climb, that's pretty much a cruise. Stay right of the bolt line the whole way, particularly after the 3rd bolt where looking left will show you nothing but a blank wall. A nice shelf for a rest before you take care of the last 2 bolts.
Another of the long routes at Robinson.  Pretty easy as you go with what challenge there is coming in the last 10-15 feet.
You will make a great impression as you cruise up this easy but interesting route. Bear in mind Claude Monet was the founder of the Impressionist movement
content.location: This route is between Free Cholo and Giverny

content.description: After some feedback this route has been reconfigured.  It's now a nice warmup and super easy 5.5.   Anchors are now below the shelf eliminating what used to be an awkward move.  Give it another try.

In 1890-91, Claude Monet created 25 paintings of haystacks! He was interested in how the colors of these stacks changed at different times of the day. Here at Robinson Bluff we have the modern version of haystacks - huge round hay bales, wrapped in plastic, lining the edge of the field just across the river. One wonders if Monet would find them as interesting.
content.location: Between the 2 easy routes Chuck decided to sneak in a 10b.

content.description: A tricky little route that requires some thought for a 5.9.  Take it slowly, decide whether to follow the bolt line (harder) or stay to the side and enjoy the trip to the top.

This line starts on a vertical face right of Ray's Cow Bell. The route gets less steep the higher you climb but offers a great layback on a left facing flake feature. the crux of the route is in the lower to mid portion of the climb. Rap anchors allow for an easy lower when finished.
content.location: This line starts on a vertical face right of Ray's Cow Bell.

content.description: This climbs the beautiful vertical blunt arete and finishes on a steep layback up high.  Stick clip the first bolt.
content.location: This is the last route on the Monet Wall, just right of Giverny.

content.description: Wall: A perfect warm up wall for those looking to stay under 5.10. This is your spot!Routes are roughly 60 ft tall and provide a range from easy to more difficult moderates (range from 5.5 to 5.10b).Please provide feedback using your MP App. Star rating and rate difficulty feedback helps the next visitors use the app.
